problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        x_pos: int = assignments[i].x
        y_pos: int = assignments[i].y
        
        # Item must fit within box dimensions
        assert x_pos + item_width <= box_width
        assert y_pos + item_height <= box_height
        assert x_pos >= 0
        assert y_pos >= 0

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Ensure all box IDs are consistent between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- constraints ---
def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Ensure rectangles do not overlap
                # They overlap if neither is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                       (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                       (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                       (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_one_item_per_box_assignment(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    # Each item is assigned to exactly one box (enforced by box_id assignment)
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 20

ensure_one_item_per_box_assignment(item_box_assignments)

# Ensure all box IDs and positions are consistent between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)

# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Get item dimensions and assignment
        item_w: int = items[i].width
        item_h: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y
        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        
        # Item must fit within the box boundaries
        assert pos_x + item_w <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_h <= box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 20

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Ensure all variables with same redundant fields are equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # No overlap condition: at least one of these must be true
            # Item 1 is to the left of Item 2
            # Item 1 is to the right of Item 2
            # Item 1 is above Item 2
            # Item 1 is below Item 2
            assert (
                assignments[i].box_id != assignments[j].box_id or
                assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or
                assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x or
                assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or
                assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y
            )

no_overlap_constraints(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

# Ensure all variables with same redundant fields are equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

def ensure_item_assignment_uniqueness(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (enforced by domain)
    # Box_id must be between 1 and 20 (enforced by field bounds)
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_uniqueness(item_box_assignments)

# Ensure all variables with same redundant fields are equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items assigned to the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # No overlap condition: rectangles do not overlap if one is to the left, right, above, or below the other

                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Assignment of each item to a box

objective:

def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),

    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        assignment: BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
        
        # Items must fit within the box dimensions
        assert assignment.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert assignment.y + item.height <= box_height
        
        # Positions must be non-negative (already constrained by Field, so redundant check omitted)
        assert assignment.box_id >= 1
        assert assignment.box_id <= 20

def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Assert that rectangles do not overlap
                # They overlap if: x1_min < x2_max and x2_min < x1_max and y1_min < y2_max and y2_min < y1_max
                # So they do NOT overlap if at least one of these is false
                assert (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                       (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                       (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                       (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        assignment: BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
        
        # Items must fit within the box dimensions
        assert assignment.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert assignment.y + item.height <= box_height
        
        # Positions must be non-negative (already constrained by Field, so redundant check omitted)
        assert assignment.box_id >= 1

def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Assert that rectangles do not overlap
                # They overlap if: x1_min < x2_max and x2_min < x1_max and y1_min < y2_max and y2_min < y1_max
                # So they do NOT overlap if at least one of these is false
                assert (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                       (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                       (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                       (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    placements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if placements[i].box_id == placements[j].box_id:
                # Calculate boundaries for item i
                i_right: int = placements[i].x + items[i].width
                i_top: int = placements[i].y + items[i].height
                
                # Calculate boundaries for item j
                j_right: int = placements[j].x + items[j].width
                j_top: int = placements[j].y + items[j].height
                
                # Assert that the rectangles do not overlap

                assert not (
                    placements[i].x < j_right and
                    i_right > placements[j].x and

def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    placements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement),

                       (placements[j].x + items[j].width <= placements[i].x) or \

# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item), 
                       placements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Item must fit within box boundaries
        assert placements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert placements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Position coordinates must be non-negative
        assert placements[i].x >= 0
        assert placements[i].y >= 0

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(placements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement), 
               items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item)):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if placements[i].box_id == placements[j].box_id:
                # Calculate boundaries for item i
                right_i: int = placements[i].x + items[i].width
                top_i: int = placements[i].y + items[i].height
                # Calculate boundaries for item j
                right_j: int = placements[j].x + items[j].width
                top_j: int = placements[j].y + items[j].height
                # Assert that the rectangles do not overlap
                assert right_i <= placements[j].x or right_j <= placements[i].x or \
                       top_i <= placements[j].y or top_j <= placements[i].y

no_overlap(x_y_positions, ITEMS)

# Ensure box assignments match placement records
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i] == x_y_positions[i].box_id

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)), 
                                       x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert item_box_assignments[i] == x_y_positions[i].box_id

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
